description.zh-cn: 美国浸信会牧师、社会活动家，以及非裔美国人民权运动的主要领导人，他主张以非暴力的公民抗命方法争取非裔美国人的基本权利。
description.en: An American Baptist minister and activist who was a prominent leader in the Civil Rights Movement, advocating for the civil rights of African Americans through nonviolent civil disobedience.

description.zh-cn: 一个美国非裔民权组织，旨在利用黑人教会的道德权威和组织能力来指导非暴力抵抗活动以促进民权改革。
description.en: An African-American civil rights organization which aimed to harness the moral authority and organizing power of black churches to conduct nonviolent protests in the service of civil rights reform.

description.zh-cn: 美国作家、活动家、民权领袖，也是马丁·路德·金的妻子。
description.en: American author, activist, civil rights leader, and the wife of Martin Luther King Jr.

description.zh-cn: 美国浸信会牧师、传教士、民权运动早期的活动家，马丁·路德·金的父亲。
description.en: American Baptist pastor, missionary, and an early figure in the Civil Rights Movement. He was the father of Martin Luther King Jr.

description.zh-cn: 马丁·路德·金的母亲。
description.en: Mother of Martin Luther King Jr.

description.zh-cn: 美国民权活动家和基督教牧师，是马丁·路德·金的亲密朋友和导师，也是南方基督教领袖会议的联合创始人。
description.en: American civil rights activist and Christian minister, who was a close friend and mentor to Martin Luther King Jr. and a co-founder of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference.

description.zh-cn: 一场旨在结束美国种族隔离和歧视非裔美国人的社会运动。
description.en: A social movement in the United States whose goals were to end racial segregation and discrimination against African Americans.

description.zh-cn: 16世纪欧洲宗教改革运动的发起人，新教路德宗的开创者。
description.en: A seminal figure in the Protestant Reformation and the namesake of Lutheranism.

nodes.id: 联合抵制蒙哥马利公车运动

zh-cn: 联合抵制蒙哥马利公车运动
蒙哥马利抵制乘车运动

description.zh-cn: 一场反对阿拉巴马州蒙哥马利市公共汽车上种族隔离政策的政治和社会抗议活动。
description.en: A political and social protest campaign against the policy of racial segregation on the public transit system of Montgomery, Alabama.

description.zh-cn: 美国民权活动家，因在蒙哥马利公车上拒绝给白人让座而闻名，此举引发了联合抵制蒙哥马利公车运动。
description.en: American activist in the civil rights movement best known for her pivotal role in the Montgomery bus boycott.

description.zh-cn: 美国司法部的主要调查单位。
description.en: The domestic intelligence and security service of the United States and its principal federal law enforcement agency.

description.zh-cn: 美国联邦调查局首任局长。
description.en: The first Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) of the United States.

nodes.id: 罗伯特·弗朗西斯·肯尼迪

zh-cn: 罗伯特·弗朗西斯·肯尼迪

description.zh-cn: 美国政治家，曾任司法部长。
description.en: American politician who served as Attorney General.

description.zh-cn: 马丁·路德·金在1963年向华盛顿进军行动中发表的著名演讲，呼吁结束美国的种族主义。
description.en: A public speech delivered by American civil rights activist Martin Luther King Jr. during the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom on August 28, 1963, in which he called for an end to racism in the United States.

zh-cn: 为了工作与自由：向华盛顿进军
en: March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom

description.zh-cn: 1963年举行的大规模人权政治集会，旨在为非裔美国人争取公民和经济权利。
description.en: A major political rally for human rights, calling for civil and economic rights for African Americans, held in 1963.

description.zh-cn: 一场发生在第二次印度支那战争期间的冲突，美国及其盟友支持南越，对抗由北越和越共支持的共产主义势力。
description.en: A conflict in Vietnam, Laos, and Cambodia from 1 November 1955 to the fall of Saigon on 30 April 1975.

en: Assassination of Martin Luther King Jr.

description.zh-cn: 1968年4月4日，马丁·路德·金在田纳西州孟菲斯的洛林汽车旅馆被暗杀。
description.en: The assassination of Martin Luther King Jr. occurred on April 4, 1968, at the Lorraine Motel in Memphis, Tennessee.

description.zh-cn: 被判谋杀马丁·路德·金的罪犯。
description.en: The convicted assassin of Martin Luther King Jr.

zh-cn: 莫罕达斯·卡拉姆昌德·甘地

description.zh-cn: 印度律师、反殖民民族主义者和政治伦理学家，他采用非暴力抵抗来领导印度成功地从英国的统治中独立出来。
description.en: Indian lawyer, anti-colonial nationalist, and political ethicist, who employed nonviolent resistance to lead the successful campaign for India's independence from British rule.

description.zh-cn: 美国民权运动领袖，马丁·路德·金的主要顾问和导师，也是1963年华盛顿大游行的主要组织者。
description.en: American leader in social movements for civil rights, who was a key advisor and mentor to Martin Luther King Jr. and the chief organizer of the 1963 March on Washington.

description.zh-cn: 美国第36任总统。
description.en: 36th President of the United States.

description.zh-cn: 由南方基督教领袖会议领导的一场旨在引起人们对阿拉巴马州伯明翰黑人社区融合努力的关注的运动。
description.en: A movement organized by the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC) to bring attention to the integration efforts of African American citizens in Birmingham, Alabama.

description.zh-cn: 阿拉巴马州伯明翰的公共安全专员，其在民权运动期间授权使用消防水龙和警犬对付公民抗议者的行为在美国国内外引起了公愤。
description.en: Commissioner of Public Safety for the city of Birmingham, Alabama, whose actions to enforce racial segregation and deny civil rights to African American citizens, especially during the Civil Rights Movement, made him an international symbol of bigotry.

description.zh-cn: 马丁·路德·金在阿拉巴马州伯明翰监狱中写的一封公开信。信中为非暴力抵抗种族主义的策略辩护。
description.en: An open letter written on April 16, 1963, by Martin Luther King Jr. from the city jail in Birmingham, Alabama. The letter defends the strategy of nonviolent resistance to racism.

nodes.id: 由塞尔玛向蒙哥马利进军

zh-cn: 由塞尔玛向蒙哥马利进军

description.zh-cn: 1965年举行的三次旨在争取非裔美国人投票权的抗议游行。
description.en: Three protest marches, held in 1965, to demonstrate the desire of African-American citizens to exercise their constitutional right to vote.

description.zh-cn: 马丁·路德·金遇刺后在美国各地爆发的一系列骚乱。
description.en: A wave of civil disturbance which swept the United States following the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr.

description.zh-cn: 美国一项具有里程碑意义的民权和劳动法，禁止基于种族、肤色、宗教、性别或国籍的歧视。
description.en: A landmark civil rights and labor law in the United States that outlaws discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.

description.zh-cn: 一种为实现社会或政治目标而不对自身、他人或环境造成伤害的个人实践。它源于“不伤害”的信念，是“和平”哲学的替代词。
description.en: The personal practice of being harmless to self and others under every condition. It comes from the belief that hurting people, animals or the environment is unnecessary to achieve an outcome and refers to a general philosophy of abstention from violence.

description.zh-cn: 马丁·路德·金与拉尔夫·阿伯内西等人共同创建了南方基督教领袖会议。
description.en: Martin Luther King Jr., along with Ralph Abernathy and others, co-founded the Southern Christian Leadership Conference.

description.zh-cn: 拉尔夫·阿伯内西与马丁·路德·金等人共同创建了南方基督教领袖会议。
description.en: Ralph Abernathy, along with Martin Luther King Jr. and others, co-founded the Southern Christian Leadership Conference.

description.zh-cn: 马丁·路德·金是非裔美国人民权运动中最具影响力的领导人之一。
description.en: Martin Luther King Jr. was one of the most influential leaders of the African-American Civil Rights Movement.

description.zh-cn: 老马丁·路德·金为了纪念宗教改革领袖马丁·路德，将自己和儿子的名字从迈克尔·金改为马丁·路德·金。
description.en: Martin Luther King Sr. changed his own name and his son's from Michael King to Martin Luther King in honor of the Protestant reformer Martin Luther.

description.zh-cn: 老马丁·路德·金在1934年访问德国后，为了纪念宗教改革领袖马丁·路德，将自己和儿子的名字都改为马丁·路德·金。
description.en: After a trip to Germany in 1934, Martin Luther King Sr. changed his and his son's names to Martin Luther King in honor of the Protestant Reformation leader Martin Luther.

relationships.target: 联合抵制蒙哥马利公车运动

description.zh-cn: 马丁·路德·金领导了持续385天的联合抵制蒙哥马利公车运动。
description.en: Martin Luther King Jr. led the Montgomery bus boycott, which lasted for 385 days.

relationships.target: 联合抵制蒙哥马利公车运动

description.zh-cn: 罗莎·帕克斯因拒绝在公车上让座给白人而被捕，此事件直接引发了蒙哥马利公车抵制运动。
description.en: Rosa Parks's arrest for refusing to give up her bus seat to a white man directly triggered the Montgomery bus boycott.

description.zh-cn: 在局长胡佛的指令下，联邦调查局对金进行监视、窃听，并试图通过揭露其私生活和寄送匿名信等方式来胁迫他，以削弱其作为民权领袖的地位。
description.en: Under Director Hoover's orders, the FBI conducted surveillance, wiretapped King, and attempted to coerce him by exposing his private life and sending an anonymous letter, aiming to neutralize him as a civil rights leader.

description.zh-cn: 胡佛将金视为危险人物，并亲自下令联邦调查局开展一场旨在通过监视和抹黑来摧毁其作为民权领袖地位的行动。
description.en: Hoover viewed King as a dangerous figure and personally ordered the FBI to conduct a campaign aimed at destroying him as a civil rights leader through surveillance and discreditation.

relationships.source: 罗伯特·弗朗西斯·肯尼迪

description.zh-cn: 作为司法部长，罗伯特·肯尼迪书面授权联邦调查局对马丁·路德·金的电话进行窃听。
description.en: As Attorney General, Robert F. Kennedy gave written authorization for the FBI to wiretap Martin Luther King Jr.

description.zh-cn: 作为“六大”民权领袖之一，马丁·路德·金是此次游行的主要组织者之一，并在集会上发表了《我有一个梦》的著名演讲。
description.en: As one of the 'Big Six' civil rights leaders, King was a key organizer of the march and delivered his famous 'I Have a Dream' speech at the event.

description.zh-cn: 马丁·路德·金在华盛顿大游行上发表了《我有一个梦》的演讲。
description.en: Martin Luther King Jr. delivered the 'I Have a Dream' speech at the March on Washington.

description.zh-cn: 马丁·路德·金公开发表反越战演说，谴责美国政府是“当今世界最大的暴力供应商”。
description.en: Martin Luther King Jr. publicly delivered an anti-Vietnam War speech, denouncing the U.S. government as 'the greatest purveyor of violence in the world today.'

description.zh-cn: 马丁·路德·金在孟菲斯洛林汽车旅馆的阳台上被子弹击中，不治身亡。
description.en: Martin Luther King Jr. was fatally shot on the balcony of the Lorraine Motel in Memphis.

description.zh-cn: 詹姆斯·厄尔·雷被认定为杀害马丁·路德·金的凶手。
description.en: James Earl Ray was convicted of assassinating Martin Luther King Jr.

description.zh-cn: 甘地的非暴力抵抗哲学深刻影响了马丁·路德·金的民权运动策略。
description.en: Gandhi's philosophy of nonviolent resistance profoundly influenced Martin Luther King Jr.'s strategy for the Civil Rights Movement.

description.zh-cn: 作为金的导师，拉斯丁向他介绍了甘地的非暴力抵抗教义，这对金的民权运动策略产生了深远影响。
description.en: As King's mentor, Rustin introduced him to Gandhi's teachings on nonviolent resistance, which profoundly shaped King's approach to the civil rights movement.

description.zh-cn: 拉斯丁是1963年华盛顿大游行的主要运筹和战略组织者。
description.en: Rustin was the chief logistical and strategic organizer of the 1963 March on Washington.

description.zh-cn: 马丁·路德·金和南方基督教领袖会议在伯明翰发起了一场抵制种族隔离和经济不公正的抗议运动。
description.en: Martin Luther King Jr. and the SCLC initiated a campaign in Birmingham against racial segregation and economic injustice.

description.zh-cn: 伯明翰警察局长尤金·康纳指示警察使用高压水枪和警犬来镇压抗议群众，包括儿童。
description.en: Birmingham's police chief, Eugene 'Bull' Connor, directed the use of high-pressure water jets and police attack dogs on protesters, including children.

description.zh-cn: 在伯明翰运动期间被捕入狱时，金撰写了《伯明翰狱中书信》。
description.en: While incarcerated during the Birmingham campaign, King wrote the 'Letter from Birmingham Jail'.

relationships.target: 由塞尔玛向蒙哥马利进军

description.zh-cn: 金和南方基督教领袖会议共同组织了由塞尔玛向蒙哥马利进军的系列游行，以争取投票权。
description.en: King and the SCLC helped organize the Selma to Montgomery marches to campaign for voting rights.

description.zh-cn: 马丁·路德·金的遇刺在美国各地引发了一系列种族骚乱。
description.en: The assassination of Martin Luther King Jr. triggered a wave of race riots across the United States.

description.zh-cn: 华盛顿大游行，特别是金的演讲，使民权运动成为美国改革家的首要议题，并推动了1964年《民权法案》的通过。
description.en: The March on Washington, and particularly King's speech, made civil rights a top issue for American reformers and facilitated the passage of the Civil Rights Act of 1964.

description.zh-cn: 拉尔夫·阿伯内西是马丁·路德·金的亲密朋友、同事，并在金遇刺后接任南方基督教领袖会议主席。
description.en: Ralph Abernathy was a close friend and colleague of Martin Luther King Jr., succeeding him as president of the SCLC after his assassination.

description.zh-cn: 马丁·路德·金是“非暴力”公民抗命方法的主要倡导者和实践者。
description.en: Martin Luther King Jr. was a leading advocate and practitioner of the method of 'nonviolent' civil disobedience.
